Translation of a wedge-shaped object by ⟨3,2,-3⟩, T3,2,-3

Scaling the same object by factors of 1/2, 1/2, and 3, in x, y, and z, respectively, S1/2,1/2,3

Reflecting the same object through the yz plane, F

(It is a bit strange to show this as an animation, since it is usually parameterized as a scaling, the way I show it here. But it definitely shows both the physical impossibility of the action with ordinary objects and therefore the fact that it is clearly not a rotation.)

Rotation of the same object by -65° around the x axis, R-65°,0,0

Rotation of the same object by 45° around the y axis, R0,45°,0

Rotation of the same object by 60° around the z axis, R0,0,60°

Combination of several transformations applied to the same object in sequence, T-2,0,0R0,0,60°S1/3,1/3,1/3
